message_1:
In a game of Stag Hunt, Alice and Bob can choose to either hunt a stag (worth 5 points) or a hare (worth 3 points). If they both choose to hunt the stag, they each earn 5 points. If one hunts a stag and the other hunts a hare, the one who hunted the stag earns 1 point and the one who hunted the hare earns 3 points. If they both choose to hunt a hare, they each earn 2 points.

Assuming Alice and Bob have the same payoff matrix for the game, what strategy should they both adopt in order to maximize their total points earned if they play the game multiple times?
message_2:
To maximize their total points earned when playing the game multiple times, Alice and Bob should adopt a strategy of cooperation and communication. They should both agree to hunt the stag consistently, as this will result in the highest possible payoff for both players (5 points each).

If they both choose to hunt the stag and trust each other to do so, they will consistently earn 5 points each, which is the highest possible outcome. If they were to choose to hunt the hare, they would only earn 2 points each, which is a lower payoff.

In summary, the best strategy for Alice and Bob to maximize their total points earned when playing the Stag Hunt game multiple times is to cooperate and consistently choose to hunt the stag together.
